channel.title: OnOptions
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from OnOptions, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Google Is Suddenly Beating Its Magnificent 7 Peers in the AI Race
item.description: Alphabet stock has even outpaced Nvidia over the last year.

item.title: I chatted to Ray Dalio’s AI doppelgänger: It claims there’s a 75% chance the AI bubble bursts in 2026, isn’t so worried about national debt—and wouldn’t say which stocks to avoid
item.description: "One thing I’ve learned over the years," the freshly-launched bot muses, "Is that rapid, debt-financed build-outs often precede sharp adjustments.

item.title: Suddenly, the Fed interest rate cut in December looks like it is very much back on the table
item.description: Last week, Wall Street seemed to have decided that a December cut was off the table. Today, speculators put the probability of Fed Chairman Jerome Pow...

item.title: The 2026 Job Market Will Look a Lot Like 2025, Forecasters Say
item.description: A new analysis by Indeed forecasts employers won’t increase hiring much next year, as the conditions that stalled the labor market this year persist.

item.title: This CEO just sold his company for $21 billion. It wouldn’t have happened without federally funded research

item.title: Why the urge to persuade can undermine your idea for change
item.description: Every good salesperson knows the 7-step process in which you identify and qualify a prospect to understand their needs, then present your offer, overc...

item.title: Gen-Z Can’t Stop Using the Slang Term ‘Skibidi’ in Passwords
item.description: Here are other popular passwords that your team should never use.

item.title: How Do I Fire Someone in an Open Plan Office?
item.description: It’s hard to have a private conversation when everyone can see what’s happening.

item.title: Why 90% of decisions don’t reach this Land O’Lakes exec’s desk
item.description: Land O’Lakes’ Leah Anderson avoids the trap of endless analysis by asking one question: Will more information change the outcome or just make you feel...

item.title: Crypto is getting punched in the face again—but this is no 2022
item.description: Bitcoin nearly fell below $80,000 and it could get worse. But the fundamentals are different this time.

item.title: Make-A-Wish requests for content creators have more than doubled in the past decade
item.description: More children are cashing in their Make-A-Wish requests to meet their favorite content creators, with creator wishes more than doubling in the past de...

item.title: AI isn’t just automating jobs. It’s creating new layers of human work
item.description: As I said in previous articles, executives like to say they’re “integrating AI.” But most still treat artificial intelligence as a feature, not a foun...

item.title: How This Streetwear Designer Pushes the Boundaries of Fashion
item.description: Yoon Ahn, co-founder of Ambush, on amplifying her brand’s distinctive voice.

item.title: Kids will keep these practical gifts for years

item.title: F1 has thrived by democratizing what was once a ‘look, don’t touch’ sport, says McLaren Racing CEO Zak Brown
item.description: Also: All the news and watercooler chat from Fortune.
